definition: to make insinuations/to take an indirect approach (in making inquiries) (idiom)
one side/other/different/lateral component of a Chinese character (such as 刂[dao1], 亻[ren2] etc)
to hit/to strike/to tap/to rap/to knock/to rip sb off/to overcharge

sentences.english: I mean, I was just winging it, But that's good.
sentences.chinese: 真的？是嗎，我只是旁敲側擊了下，不錯。

sentences.english: Cunning suspicious of her to Ye Lingqing again after the beat about the bush.
sentences.chinese: 之後，狡猾多疑的她又對葉凌青旁敲側擊。

sentences.english: She insinuated to us that her partner had embezzled funds.
sentences.chinese: 她旁敲側擊地指出她的合夥人盜用了資金。

sentences.english: Don't beat around the bush! What do you want to say?
sentences.chinese: 不要旁敲側擊了，你想說什麼？

sentences.english: Cheng Yakun attack by innuendo, the total can not directly said to be him.
sentences.chinese: 成亞坤旁敲側擊，總不能直接說是他吧。

definition: inside information/the ins and outs of the matter/how things stand/what's up
to think for oneself and act accordingly (idiom); to act on one's own initiative
to mention sth without elaborating (idiom); not giving details
to reason/to argue logically
to ask oneself honestly/to search in one's heart
to fool/to hoodwink/to dupe
stratagem
harmful teachings/evil doctrine
to guide patiently and systematically (idiom)
to have no news whatever
to sound out the difficulties and retreat to avoid defeat (idiom); fig. to back out of an awkward situation/to get out on finding out what it's really like
(accounting) to balance the books/to do the accounts/(fig.) to settle an account/to get one's revenge
pass like thunder and move like the wind (idiom); swift and decisive reaction
to decide and act alone (idiom); to take arbitrary action/a law unto oneself
depressed/sulky/moody/unhappy
to admonish
